definitions.definition: the lowest part or edge of something, especially the part on which it rests or is supported.
examples: she sat down at the base of a tree

definitions.definition: the part of a column between the shaft and pedestal or pavement.
the end at which a part or organ is attached to the trunk or main part.
examples: a shoot is produced at the base of the stem

definitions.definition: a line or surface on which a figure is regarded as standing.
a line of known length used in triangulation.
the lowest part of a shield.
a conceptual structure or entity on which something draws or depends.
something used as a foundation or starting point for further work; a basis.
examples: uses existing data as the base for the study
synonyms: backbone "the system uses existing technology as its base"

definitions.definition: a group of people regarded as supporting an organization, for example by buying its products.
the main place where a person works or stays.
examples: she makes the studio her base

definitions.definition: a place used as a center of operations by the armed forces or others; a headquarters.
examples: the corporal headed back to base
synonyms: starting point "the troops returned to their base"

definitions.definition: a main or important element or ingredient to which other things are added.
examples: soaps with a vegetable oil base

definitions.definition: a substance used as a foundation for makeup.
a substance such as water or oil into which a pigment is mixed to form paint.
a substance capable of reacting with an acid to form a salt and water, or (more broadly) of accepting or neutralizing hydrogen ions.
a purine or pyrimidine group in a nucleotide or nucleic acid.
the middle part of a bipolar transistor, separating the emitter from the collector.
the root or stem of a word or a derivative.
the uninflected form of a verb.
a number used as the basis of a numeration scale.
a number in terms of which other numbers are expressed as logarithms.
one of the four stations that must be reached in turn to score a run.
have as the foundation for (something); use as a point from which (something) can develop.
examples: the film is based on a novel by Pat Conroy
synonyms: root; Moreuse as a basis; derive from
issue from "he based his idea on a movie"

definitions.definition: situate as the center of operations.
examples: a research program based at the University of Arizona
synonyms: establish; garrison "the company was based in Quebec"

definitions.definition: the underlying support or foundation for an idea, argument, or process.
examples: trust is the only basis for a good working relationship

definitions.definition: the system or principles according to which an activity or process is carried on.
examples: she needed coaching on a regular basis

definitions.definition: the justification for or reasoning behind something.
examples: on the basis of these statistics, important decisions are made
